intro: Trichosanthes bracteata var. tomentosa, commonly known as the hairy bitter melon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its distinctive, spiny fruits. The fruit is typically harvested when immature, as it becomes bitter and inedible when fully mature. It is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
